thread.title: Cowboys to play in Pro Football Hall of Fame game days before Jerry Jones' induction
thread.title_full: Cowboys to play in Pro Football Hall of Fame game days before Jerry Jones' induction

author: SportsDayDFW.com
title: Cowboys to play in Pro Football Hall of Fame game days before Jerry Jones' induction
text:
Cowboys to play in Pro Football Hall of Fame game days before Jerry Jones' induction This   Staff Photographer Dallas Cowboys owner Jerry Jones is congratulated after a press conference with Pro Football Hall of Fame Class of 2017 at the NFL Honors awards show in advance of Super Bowl LI on Saturday, Feb. 4, 2017, in Houston. (Smiley N. Pool/The Dallas Morning News) By SportsDayDFW.com Contact SportsDayDFW.com on Twitter: @SportsDayDFW 
The Dallas Cowboys will play the Arizona Cardinals in the Pro Football Hall of Fame game at Canton, Ohio. 
The game will be Thursday for the first time -- August 3 at 7 p.m. Central. Owner Jerry Jones will be inducted into the Hall on Saturday, Aug. 5. 
The game is a preseason game. The Cowboys will now play five exhibition games instead of the usual four. 
The rest of the Cowboys' schedule will be announced in April, but we already know the regular-season opponents (and Dallas has a tough schedule). 
Last year's Hall of Fame game was cancelled because of field quality conditions at Tom Benson Stadium. 
The last time Dallas played in the game was 2013 against the Miami Dolphins, before Larry Allen was inducted. 
Cowboys in Hall of Fame Game (2-3) 
1968 - vs. Chicago Bears (L, 24-30) 
1979 - vs. Oakland Raiders (L, 13-20) 
1999 - vs. Cleveland Browns (L, 17-20 OT) 
2010 - vs. Cincinnati Bengals (W, 16-7) 
2013 - vs. Miami Dolphins (W, 24-20) BREAKING NEWS: The @dallascowboys will play the @AZCardinals in the Hall of Fame Game! #PFHOF17 pic.twitter.com/X5VpsLbkbf â€” Pro Football HOF (@ProFootballHOF) February 23, 2017 This Topic is Missing Your Voice. View Comments
